DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em engenharia metalúrgica pela Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto (UFOP- 2005) , mestrado em engenharia aeronáutica pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (ITA - 2009) e doutorado em ciências e engenharia de materiais pela Universidade de São Paulo (USP-2012). Tem experiência na área de engenharia aeroespacial, com ênfase em materiais e processos para engenharia aeronáutica e aeroespacial, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: ligas de Cobre, Titânio comercialmente puro, aços inoxidáveis, aços de alta resistência, processos especiais de soldagem, tratamento térmico, processamento de materiais a laser (soldagem, brasagem, tratamento de superfície e conformação), caracterização mecânica e microestrutural. Atualmente é professora adjunto da Universidade Federal do Espírito Santo / UFES.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor's at Engenharia Metalurgica from Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto (2005) and doctorate at Material and Metallurgical Engineering from Universidade de São Paulo (2012). Has experience in Aerospace Engineering, focusing on Materials and Processes for Aeronautical and Aerospace Engineering, acting on the following subjects: laser beam welding, steels, TIG welding and pneumatic workbench.

GRADUACAO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-DE-CONCLUSAO-DE-CURSO: Análise comportamental de aços siliciosos GO soldados empregando-se diferentes metais de adiçãois de adição

MESTRADO-PROFISSIONALIZANTE.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Soldagem com laser a fibra do aço ligado 300M de alta resistência

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Estágio de férias. Acompanhamento do processo de soldagem TIG e laminação dos aços ao silício GO e GNO.
Estágio de férias. Acompanhamento das linhas de acabamento e de tesouras da seção de laminação de tiras a quente.

Importação de matéria prima; Abertura, comfecçaão de laudo e acompanhamento dos Drwbacks; planejamento e controle de produção das unidades do Brasil e da França. Análise de fluxograma de produção/ processo, levantamento de custo fixo e variável, estimativa de custo de start ? up, produção e custos de insumos para fase de comissiona mento e cálculo de blends. Implantação do programa de excelência operacional , reestruturação das práticas operacionais de processos e suporte à produção.

Participação do programa de especialização em engenharia aeronáutica, com duração de 18 meses e dedicação integral. A carga horária foi composta por aulas ministradas pelos professores do ITA, por palestras e pela elaboração de um projeto multidisciplinar de uma aeronave, totalizando cerca de 2.600 de aulas. Cursos: Finanças, Nastran, Catia

Análise de desenho técnico para confecção de corpos-de-prova para ensaio de materiais. Especificação e catalogação de materiais. Desenvolvimento de projetos em CATIA. Acompanhamento junto à produção da confecção dos corpos-de-prova. Elaboração de relatórios técnicos para certificação junto a ANAC.
Tema: Otimização do processo de soldagem TIG do aço ao silício de grão orientado (GO).
Tema: Efeito da concentração de cloretos na caracterização eletroquímica de aços inoxidáveis
Tema: Comportamento mecânico de um aço estrutural soldado aplicando-se as técnicas de soldagem ao arco elétrico com eletrodo revestido e gás.

OUTRA-ATIVIDADE-TECNICO-CIENTIFICA.ATIVIDADE-REALIZADA: Processo de Fotoionização Seletiva a Laser em Isótopos de Terras-Raras: Nd e Yb

ENSINO.DISCIPLINA: Seleção dos Materiais; Conformação Mecânica; Laboratório de Materiais; Processamento de Materiais a Laser

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolver um arcabouço de conhecimento técnico-científico referente ao processamento a laser de materiais, nas áreas de soldagem, revestimento e texturização a laser, de forma a apoiar as atividades de ensino e pesquisa do Departamento de Engenharia Mecânica da UFES.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ESTUDO DO PROCESSO DE ESTAMPAGEM A QUENTE DE CHAPAS DE AÇO DE ALTA RESISTÊNCIA MECÂNICA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto de pesquisa visa desenvolver capacidade de produzir, em escala laboratorial, um sistema integrado de forno e ferramenta de conformação refrigerada de forma a produzir chapas de aço de alta resistência mecânica pelo processo de estampagem a quente. Espera-se que o equipamento permita desenvolver, em escala piloto, capacitação de alunos nas áreas de transferência de calor e massa, modelamento de processos mecânicos, metalurgia física e comportamento mecânico de aços.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA
CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O programa Competição SAE BRASIL AeroDesign é um desafio lançado aos estudantes de Engenharia que tem como principal objetivo propiciar a difusão e o intercâmbio de técnicas e conhecimentos de Engenharia Aeronáutica, através de aplicações práticas e da competição entre equipes. Ao participar do programa SAE AeroDesign o aluno se envolve com um caso real de desenvolvimento de projeto aeronáutico, desde sua a concepção, projeto detalhado, construção e testes.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Escola de Engenharia de São Carlos

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Escola de Engenharia de São Carlos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: The study, development and application of a hybrid process: Additive Manufacturing (AM) plus High Speed Machining/Grinding (HSM/G)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Economic and sustainable production is among the most recent and enduring challenges being faced by the manufacturing area nowadays. The Additive Manufacturing (AM), capable of producing with flexibility, fully automation and sustainability, arises with a strong appeal to replace traditional processes such as casting, forging and conventional machining. AM technology was addressed in a workshop at IPT in 2015, with the presence of directors, researchers and representatives from industry and FAPESP. Due to the importance of the subject, it was suggested a gathering of main institutions working with AM in the State of São Paulo, in order to align the efforts for further development of such recent and innovative manufacturing technology. After a series of meetings the team put together the present proposal and highlights that future developments using AM technology are, however, marked by a number of technological challenges, some of them addressed in the project proposed herein. The surface finishing of workpieces produced by AM is one of them, since it may not meet some high performance applications. Thus, subtractive processes such as High Speed Machining/Grinding (HSM/G) may be employed, creating a new class of processes known as Hybrid Processes (HPr). Other issues within this almost unknown field are the metallurgical quality and the right amount of stock to machine the workpieces. In order to manage them, the whole powder production route, AM and HSM/G parameters have to be known and controlled, also a subject proposed to be studied by the present project. Regarding AM, two processes are being addressed: the Powder Bed Deposition-PBD and the Direct Energy Deposition-DED. The former uses laser to selectively bonds a tiny layer of metal powder, building the workpiece by adding sequential layers. The latter uses laser to create a fused pool over the substrate, injecting at it powder using a flow of inert gas. Following that, pool material is added creating the 3D shape. Finally, the present proposal aims to organize the researches and knowledge acquired to apply them into two particularly suitable products as a benchmark for a broad field of applications: a mold for injection molding of thermoplastics, and a turbine blade commonly used in energy generation plants. Both products will be obtained by using the HPr developed during the project. The outcome of the present research project will certainly promote scientific and technological advancements in AM, as well as it will contribute to create new resources in this most recent and innovative engineering area. In addition to that, the project intends to go beyond the average research goals by applying the newly acquired knowledge to manufacture real parts, which grants to it a strong innovative feature too. Annual workshops involving the project team and industrial partners are among the planned targets, as well as patent requests for possibly new processes, procedures and products. (AU)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The philosophy of the Brazilian Space Program has been founded by the science and technology developments necessary for production of the components, as well as for national autonomy. Looking at this, it has beam worked to spread the use of nationally fabricated products in order to eliminate the dependence for strategic foreign components and materials. Nevertheless, it is necessary to consider the quality of the final product and the weight limitations of the structures involved, i.e. the use of resistant and lightweight parts for the rocket engine. Among the various materials suited for the use, maraging Ni 18 highlights because of its favorable characteristics. In welding recent progress has been done to obtain joints with limited heat affected zone and low distortion, without addition of a filler metal. Plasma Arc Welding (PAW)[1,2] and Laser Beam Welding (LBW)[3] are natural choices for this job. This work studies the technical feasibility for joining 3.0 mm thick maraging steel plates using both LBW and PAW. The welding techniques involve butt joints without chamfer, at flat position, with single pass and keyhole penetration allowing high aspect ratio. For both processes, pure argon was used as shielding gas. For PAW a multiprocess power source of 300A with and direct or pulsed current was used. Plasma welding was carried out at 0.32m/min speed varying current, plasma and gas flow. The optimized parameters for the PAW conditions were 141A current, 0.6 l/min gas flux for direct current and the 170A current and 0.7 l/min flux for pulsed current. The LBW was performed using a fiber laser of 2 kW continuous power. The experimental work started with a large choice of process parameters, varying speed and laser power from 0.8 to 2.2 m/min and power from 1,400 to 1,600 W. The gas flow rate ranged from 15 to 40 l/min. The optimized welding parameter settings were 1m/min, 1,600W and 30 l/min, which had been determined based on the occurrence of a full-penetrated molte
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The philosophy of the Brazilian Space Program has been founded by the science and technology developments necessary for production of the components, as well as for national autonomy. Looking at this, it has beam worked to spread the use of nationally fabricated products in order to eliminate the dependence for strategic foreign components and materials. Nevertheless, it is necessary to consider the quality of the final product and the weight limitations of the structures involved, i.e. the use of resistant and lightweight parts for the rocket engine. Among the various materials suited for the use, maraging Ni 18 highlights because of its favorable characteristics. In welding recent progress has been done to obtain joints with limited heat affected zone and low distortion, without addition of a filler metal. Plasma Arc Welding (PAW)[1,2] and Laser Beam Welding (LBW)[3] are natural choices for this job. This work studies the technical feasibility for joining 3.0 mm thick maraging steel plates using both LBW and PAW. The welding techniques involve butt joints without chamfer, at flat position, with single pass and keyhole penetration allowing high aspect ratio. For both processes, pure argon was used as shielding gas. For PAW a multiprocess power source of 300A with and direct or pulsed current was used. Plasma welding was carried out at 0.32m/min speed varying current, plasma and gas flow. The optimized parameters for the PAW conditions were 141A current, 0.6 l/min gas flux for direct current and the 170A current and 0.7 l/min flux for pulsed current. The LBW was performed using a fiber laser of 2 kW continuous power. The experimental work started with a large choice of process parameters, varying speed and laser power from 0.8 to 2.2 m/min and power from 1,400 to 1,600 W. The gas flow rate ranged from 15 to 40 l/min. The optimized welding parameter settings were 1m/min, 1,600W and 30 l/min, which had been determined based on the occurrence of a full-penetrated molte

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Laser Beam Welding Tempered 300M Ultrahigh Mechanical Strength Steel
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Laser Beam Welding Tempered 300M Ultrahigh Mechanical Strength Steel

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the Brazilian Society of Mechanical Sciences and Engineering (Impresso)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO, S. M.;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS DE;CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;CARVALHO, SHEILA M.;DE CARVALHO, SHEILA MEDEIROS;MEDEIROS DE CARVALHO, SHEILA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: AISI 300M ultrahigh strength steel has been used in a number of high demanding applications, such as the VLS Brazilian rocket project. This work intends to propose laser beam welding, with subsequent tempering, as a possible route for the fabrication of engineering pieces of this steel. A 2 kW fiber laser was used to produce welded coupons for metallographic, hardness and tensile strength tests. It has been shown that convenient laser parameters for a 3 mm thick plate are 50 mm/s welding speed and 1200 W laser power. However, both welded materials and heat-affected zones presented high hardness and negligible plastic deformation. In order to produce useful engineering parts, it was suggested a tempering treatment for 2 hours at temperatures of 200 or 400°C. Tensile mechanical testing has shown that welded and tempered coupons presented both yield and maximum strengths comparable to the unwelded material. On the other hand, a maximum elongation of about 4% was obtained, in comparison with 12% from the bulk sample

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fiber Laser Beam Welding Between Niobium and Titanium
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Fiber Laser Beam Welding Between Niobium and Titanium

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Aircraft and Spacecraft Technology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Niobium and titanium are difficult to weld because of many factors, such as their tendency to oxidize and burn and the relatively high melting temperatures. Here, fiber laser beam welding has been proposed to weld Nb and Ti sheets in overlap geometry. In the current research, one millimeter thick CP-Ti was placed at the top and a 3 mm pure Nb stay underneath. The laser parameters were power between 1000 and 1400 W and speed between 20 and 60 mm/s, with the focus on the upper surface (beam diameter of 0.1 mm). The fusion depth varied, but the average value was 1.7±0.3 mm, i.e. about 0.7 mm into the Nb-phase. The microstructure was characterized by a partial dissolution between the Nb-rich and Ti-rich regions all over the β(Nb, Ti) solid solution at high temperatures. The micro-constituents presents slightly different hardnesses from 130 to 180 HV0.05 depending on the region. The welds are defect free, even at the interface between the plates and around the phase modulations. These features indicate that the laser beam welding of Ti-Nb alloys could be a valuable technique for the fabrication of aerospace components.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Niobium and titanium are difficult to weld because of many factors, such as their tendency to oxidize and burn and the relatively high melting temperatures. Here, fiber laser beam welding has been proposed to weld Nb and Ti sheets in overlap geometry. In the current research, one millimeter thick CP-Ti was placed at the top and a 3 mm pure Nb stay underneath. The laser parameters were power between 1000 and 1400 W and speed between 20 and 60 mm/s, with the focus on the upper surface (beam diameter of 0.1 mm). The fusion depth varied, but the average value was 1.7±0.3 mm, i.e. about 0.7 mm into the Nb-phase. The microstructure was characterized by a partial dissolution between the Nb-rich and Ti-rich regions all over the β(Nb, Ti) solid solution at high temperatures. The micro-constituents presents slightly different hardnesses from 130 to 180 HV0.05 depending on the region. The welds are defect free, even at the interface between the plates and around the phase modulations. These features indicate that the laser beam welding of Ti-Nb alloys could be a valuable technique for the fabrication of aerospace components.
